revised_title: Crystal Structure Analysis of Pentaerythritol Tetra-acetate
tldr: The authors conducted an X-ray crystal analysis of pentaerythritol tetra-acetate and determined its crystal structure. They found that the central carbon atom in the molecule has a four-fold alternating axis, which is in line with chemical and physical considerations. The molecule has a tetragonal bipyramidal class symmetry, and the crystal structure consists of two molecules per unit cell.
